quote_last: . He has no idea what he's doing out of bed: he has no need to relieve himself, nor is he disturbed by a dream or some element of the day before, or even by the state of the world.
title: Saturday
author: Ian McEwan

quote_first: Fyodor Pavlovich went to bed very late, at
quote_last: in the morning, and until then would pace around the room or sit in his armchair and think.
title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
